#titlebar("Volunteer with Curriki" "" "" "purple" )
Welcome to Curriki Volunteers, your home for learning about volunteer opportunities and connecting with other Curriki volunteers. Whether you're connected through a business, academic, or community organization, or an individual looking to pitch in, we're glad you're here!
#subtitlebar("Individual volunteers" "" "" "purple" )
If you are new to Curriki, take a look at the [FAQ page>Main.FAQ] to learn more about Curriki and why volunteers like you are essential to our work.
Once you are familiar with Curriki, please [become a member>Main.JoinCurriki]. Registering as a member enables you to use all of our tools and connect with other volunteers and projects.
#subtitlebar("Group volunteers" "" "" "purple" )
Business, academic, and community organizations can create a special partnership with Curriki to develop materials or support their members. For more information on how your organization can partner with Curriki, send an email to {mailto:volunteer@curriki.org}.
Sun Microsystems, Curriki's founding company, encourages employees to volunteers and/or donate to Curriki to help educators worldwide.
The National Association of Retired Teachers is a Curriki partner. NRTA members can contribute and review Curriki materials via special partner projects.
#subtitlebar("Keep up to date" "" "" "purple" )
Curriki volunteers will post project information, pod casts and blogs on the Curriki repository. Links to these will be available on this page.
#subtitlebar("Get Started" "" "" "purple" )
*Contribute*: As a registered user of Curriki, use MyCurriki to add your own material: books, lesson plans, tests, blog, etc. Make your materials available to the Curriki community. Add other Curriki materials to your collection and experiment with the editing tools.
*Collaborate*: Invite colleagues and friends to join Curriki and work with you on improving materials in the repository or adding new content.
*Review*: Browse the Curriki repository for subject matter that interests you, read the material, and provide comments via the Curriki reviewer template (coming soon).
*Translate*: Apply your language skills to translate the pages into another language. Post your translated pages in the repository and send an email to {mailto:translations@curriki.org} with the information about your work.
*Test*: New Curriki software releases need beta testers. Email {mailto:beta@curriki.org} for information on the latest release, new features, and how to provide feedback.
